title: Quarkus 3, memory leak, NotAMockException when using mockito clearInlineMocks
body:
### Describe the bug
In the newest Quarkus-3Alpha4 we observe memory leak leading to OOM in tests. The MAT shows that mockito is holding 
references in a concurrent weak map (`org.mockito.internal.util.concurrent.WeakConcurrentMap`), but it is not cleaned often enough. 
The 2.15.2 version works just fine

As workaround, to prevent memory leaks in mockito (we have some OOM due to large object and many tests), tried to add `Mockito.framework().clearInlineMocks();` which solves the memory problem, but quarkus stops injecting real mocks then
and I get NotAMockException.

### Expected behavior

No memory leak should happen or resetting mockito mocks
should be possible

### Actual behavior

OOM or the error with the workaround

### How to Reproduce?
The reproducer shows only that our workaround for 
preventing memory leak doesn't work. Although it might be a bug
as well

[project.tar.gz](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/10767516/project.tar.gz)
run ./mvnw test in reproducer
